item.title: PSYC 126 Attraction and Relationships
item.description: PSYC 126 Attraction and Relationships Lecture 1 September 2nd, 2021 Attachment Goals Discuss the basic research process in the field of psychology Define, describe, and apply a broad range of close relationship psychology theories Critically evaluate psyc findings Harry Harlow Rhesus monkeys raised in social isolation and reared on two mothers wire mother↔is not cozy cloth mother↔is cozy Previous assumption↔love is about survival An extreme position, made popular by psychologists like John Watson, held that young children should never be caressed, held or physically comforted by parents Harlow demolished behaviorism’s claim that infant attachment depends on food.
